text: Senate Republican show vote on GND is part of broader effort to elevate @AOC & new liberal stars. NRSC now tracks potential Senate candidates vote % with AOC just like Pelosi.

text: Can you really apologize for a tweet that included 17 exclamation points?
author: pkcapitol

text:
Caps goalie Holtby will not join team at White House Monday to celebrate Stanley Cup: 
“For me, it’s just a personal thing. I believe in what I believe in, and in order to stick to those values, I think I have to do what I feel is right."
author: pkcapitol

text: Here's a thought on electoral college: If you want the general election to be one national popular vote contest, do you also support one national popular vote for the primary nominating contest?
author: pkcapitol

text: 1st-term House R, very conservative, Cruz's former chief of staff, gave hearty defense of McCain in tweetstorm last night. Roy even defended McCain's thumbs-down on ACA repeal, saying it was a "fake" bill.
author: pkcapitol

text: Literally, that was the 1st joke that I made, asking Chris to wait a minute so I could check the Georgetown score!
author: pkcapitol

text:
WaPo readers have their priorities just right today, as seen by our most-read stories at the moment --
3: Murdoch's son takes control of Fox
2: Trump attacks McCain, again 
..... and our most read story ...
1: NCAA bracket picks by hoops experts.
author: pkcapitol

text:
You're tired of all the thinly sourced, always-on-background stories about Amy Klobuchar's weird boss habits, right? 
Well, here's a true policy story, all-on-record story about her very tough-on-crime years as prosecutor. 
By @eliseviebeck @myhlee
author: pkcapitol

text: My version of this is more douche/this town style. I got out of the car at CNN on 1st St NW and nearly got run over by dude in full sprint and then a cop on a bike. Full pursuit. Broad daylight.
author: pkcapitol

text: McCain’s chief/alter ego Mark raises great point: harder for Trump to deal with McCain in death than alive - he struggled to lower flags to half staff.
author: pkcapitol

text:
It’s a historically slow start to this new Senate, illustrating a broader GOP issue about its diminished agenda heading into 2020. 

Not surprisingly, McConnell is now running a Reid-style approach. 
(Because, always.)
author: pkcapitol

text: McCain’s PHX services were overseen by AZ state gov’t and protected by state troopers. Then Congress hosted McCain laying in state. Then Naval Academy hosted burial. All Trump did was allow military flight from PHX to Andrews, carrying McCain.
author: pkcapitol

text: Context -- what tweet/reply did she like?
author: pkcapitol

text:
Is there any better name for a Philly phan than Joe DiBiaggio? 
Joe founded Phans of Philly, doing travel packages for Philly phans. Months ago he reserved 500 tickets in right field for Harper’s return to DC April 2.
What a guy.
author: pkcapitol

text: I love "Yung Demz", Burgess, and I'm gonna see if my editors approve of "Nu Demz", although some might think that is a Nu @wexler reference.
author: pkcapitol

text: That's actually what I kinda thought when I heard Biden use the term, like he was dating himself to the LBJ/McCarthy era. But is this being rehashed, and is it a good thing or a pejorative? Back then it was kinda pejorative.
author: pkcapitol

text: Is "New Left" actually a thing now? I heard Biden say that the other day, but I thought that was just an older guy searching for a term. Now, it's in this Buzzfeed headline. Is this a thing? A pejorative? A good label?
author: pkcapitol

text:
I'm going out on a limb: This is the 1st time @JohnnyIsakson has ever had the congressional press corp live tweeting his every utterance on local GA radio.
Maybe @ajconwashington can fact-check me on this.
author: pkcapitol

text:
“We raised the money to buy this hotel & keep the Dubliner. So every time you drink, you drink to Terry McAuliffe. And it is time for an  Irishman to be back in the White House.”
@LVozzella should get combat pay for Dubliner duty on St. Patty's Day.
author: pkcapitol

text: It's easy for Harwood to laugh -- he's only gotten a little more grey but otherwise has aged fine.
author: pkcapitol

text: So @mviser were just discussing the variations on all these ideas prompting answers like "everything is on the table" & that's an issue that "should be open for discussion" & an issue that requires "real talk".
author: pkcapitol

text: Nope. I’ve not aged a day since 2001. Happy 40th @cspan !!!
author: pkcapitol

text: Scully hasn’t aged a day. He’s the @cspan Benjamin Button - station gets older, he gets younger.
author: pkcapitol

text: But Amy, you haven’t aged a day! This isn’t fair.
author: pkcapitol

text: I also love the sub-headline: Capitol Hill Stories. Some day I’m gonna write a book with that title. Just rambling thoughts & observations.
author: pkcapitol

text: I think I can beat Jackie & Manu. This wasn’t even my 1st @cspan appearance:
author: pkcapitol

text: Yeah, Doug you missed it. Epic tv. But not #BresTV levels.
author: pkcapitol

text: Well, given how the Angels stink, Trout will only miss 1-2 Eagles home games before heading back to Millville early October. And make it to the Linc the rest of the season. Nice to hear from you, Long. Enjoy the sunshine.
author: pkcapitol

text: Brad, your Twitter logo is of one of the most famous schools in the Philly region. You love Philly!
author: pkcapitol

text: To be fair, that Boehner Birthday Song clip was from May 2006, when he was just majority leader, when Steel toiling away for Shadegg or McCrery. The real credit for turning this '06 clip into Internet gold goes to @OhSchnitt @KG_Smith & C-Span vets like @HowardMortman
author: pkcapitol

text: Hey @cspan - happy 40th. From @SpeakerBoehner
author: pkcapitol

text:
Liberal Twitter doesn't often talk about faith, but @jaketapper prompted most important @ewarren comments. If she keeps channeling Matthew 26 - and less details on CFPB regs, less policy minutiae, she has a chance.
"I was hungry & you gave me food ... the least of thy brethren."
author: pkcapitol

text: PK Rules of Life No. 1/1.A: Never ask question (or raise a potential scenario) unless you really want to know the answer (or outcome).
author: pkcapitol

text: Sunday night things that I repeat myself at -- @iamjohnoliver is insanely brilliant.
author: pkcapitol

text: Say it just about every Sunday night, but man, these CNN #BushYears documentaries are fantastic. Going through Iraq War 1.0 now, and it's fascinating.
author: pkcapitol

text:
Do yourself a favor & read @daveweigel on Biden in #TheTrailer. It's just so smart & balanced. The easy insider take is to trash Biden & easy outsider take is to say "wow, he polls well". 
Dave does neither. Covers it all.
author: pkcapitol

text: One of Capitol Hill's greatest weddings, Hope this went off without a hitch. And gosh, I hope John behaved!
author: pkcapitol

text: Pelosi gives a shield for swing district Dems at this week's town halls. Face liberals demanding impeachment, they'll say: I'm following Pelosi. Face angry conservatives decrying "witch hunt", they'll say: Look, Pelosi doesn't want impeachment.
author: pkcapitol

text: Folks, Delaware’s favorite son is making a homecoming tonight in Dover. No, not Biden. It’s @daveweigel in the house. Follow along for Bidenisms & key things like proper local dialect & which Wawa has best service.
author: pkcapitol

text:
Stacey Abrams is very much considering a 2020 run ... and must decide whether it's for the Senate or White House, from the chief @danbalz 
"You cannot run a campaign in the 21st century that believes in a base. Every voter is a persuasion target.”
author: pkcapitol

text: A bunt toward 3B would be a double in this situation. It's not that hard to learn how to do that. That's how you end the shifts.
author: pkcapitol

text:
Sunday @pkcapitol: Pelosi tried & tried to tamp down impeachment talk, but no one listened. "Until I had a gimmick: ‘He’s not worth it.’ Boom, it explodes," she says.
How this hashtag-worthy mantra calmed the Dem caucus. 
#HesNotWorthIt

https://www.washingtonpost.com/powerpost/pelosi-tamps-down-talk-of-trump-impeachment--welcome-words-for-centrist-democrats/2019/03/15/d6836c50-4752-11e9-90f0-0ccfeec87a61_story.html?utm_term=.3b9ca3679a18 …
author: pkcapitol

text: I think Romney was more of a vision guy in 2012 while Newt tried to be Ideas/Policy Guy (as well as Mr 999 Cain). Bernie was Ideas/Policy Guy in ‘16, lost. Same with Cruz.
author: pkcapitol

text: Has the Ideas Candidate ever won the nomination in the modern primary/caucus system? Either party?
author: pkcapitol

text: One horrific thing “One Shining Moment” created is a generation of point guards never passing ball in final 10 seconds, hoping to be The Guy. Their teams suffer.
author: pkcapitol

text: Duke-UNC is a classic case of a coach who has a system (Roy) versus a guy whose system gets updated throughout the game (Coach K).
author: pkcapitol

text: A love letter to @cspan as it begins to celebrate turning 40. From the best write possible on this @ktumulty
author: pkcapitol

text: This is some sorta Ides of March joke you’re all pulling on me. Right?
